p: No statistical significant variations in food consumption and weight were observed between treated groups and the control group (p = 0.3518 and p = 0.6942, respectively). However, significant variations in food consumption were observed between females and males (p = 0.0001). Fig. 3 shows a trend of similar food consumption and weight among high dose treated groups compared to other groups as a function of time (in days) though the difference is non-significant ( Fig. 3).
